alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 10:02PM EDT until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. For the Connecticut River...including Hartford, Holyoke Dam, Northampton, Montague, Thompsonville, Holyoke, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Middle Haddam. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Flooding will likely result in the evacuation of low lying areas along River Road in Cromwell and Meadow Road in Portland. Flooding will occur in the Harbor Park area. Flooding increases in surrounding towns along the river, from Middletown and Portland to the river mouth at Old Saybrook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:55 PM EDT Monday the stage was 4.8 feet. - Bankfull stage for the Connecticut River at Middle Haddam for minor flooding is 7ft. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to 11.1 feet late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 04/02/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening at 1015 PM EDT.
